1.text: At this my heart trembleth, and is moved out of its place.

2.text: Hear ye attentively the terror of his voice, and the sound that cometh out of his mouth.

3.text: He beholdeth under all the heavens, and his light is upon the ends of the earth.

4.text: After it a noise shall roar, he shall thunder with the voice of his majesty, and shall not be found out, when his voice shall be heard.

5.text: God shall thunder wonderfully with his voice, he that doth great and unsearchable things.

6.text: He commandeth the snow to go down upon the earth, and the winter rain, and the shower of his strength.

7.text: He sealeth up the hand of all men, that every one may know his works.

8.text: Then the beast shall go into his covert, and shall abide in his den.

9.text: Out of the inner parts shall a tempest come, and cold out of the north.

10.text: When God bloweth there cometh frost, and again the waters are poured out abundantly.

11.text: Corn desireth clouds, and the clouds spread their light :

12.text: Which go round about, whithersoever the will of him that governeth them shall lead them, to whatsoever he shall command them upon the face of the whole earth :

13.text: Whether in one tribe, or in his own land, or in what place soever of his mercy he shall command them to be found.

14.text: Hearken to these things, Job : Stand, and consider the wondrous works of God.

15.text: Dost thou know when God commanded the rains, to shew his light of his clouds?

16.text: Knowest thou the great paths of the clouds, and the perfect knowledges?

17.text: Are not thy garments hot, when the south wind blows upon the earth?

18.text: Thou perhaps hast made the heavens with him, which are most strong, as if they were of molten brass.

19.text: Shew us what we may say to him : for we are wrapped up in darkness.

20.text: Who shall tell him the things I speak? even if a man shall speak, he shall be swallowed up.

21.text: But now they see not the light : the air on a sudden shall be thickened into clouds, and the wind shall pass and drive them away.

22.text: Cold cometh out of the north, and to God praise with fear.

23.text: We cannot find him worthily : he is great in strength, and in judgment, and in justice, and he is ineffable.

24.text: Therefore men shall fear him, and all that seem to themselves to be wise, shall not dare to behold him.
